<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_ndgdq4hVfn1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on something this week that is being an almost cathartic experience. I think youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll agree when I tell you what it isÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ Which is now: Editor Gizmos! </span></p>

<p><span>Tired of trying to guess which key from WSADQE you should press to rotate some way or another? So are we. The gizmos are but one part of a massive Editor overhaul we are working on for 0.26, and they should make life a LOT easier. Really, there arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t many ways to overstate just how much of an improvement this should be. I think trying to guess part rotations during construction is </span><span>the</span><span> most frustrating part of the game at the moment, so finally being able to work on thisÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ Well it feels good! IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m adding both a rotation and a translation gizmo here. Translating parts is going to be something of a new feature actuallyÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ More on that later, but construction is going to feel like a whole new game if things go as planned here.</span></p>

<p><span>Another big thing I was able to do here, which isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t very visible but should make life much easier going forward, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve merged both the VAB and SPH into one single scene. How? Well, apart from scenery, craft orientation, designated launch site and camera behavior, there isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t anything else the SPH and VAB scenes have different from each other. In fact, about 90% of the scene logic is an exact copy on both of them, so instead of having two scenes with a lot of repeated components, there is now a single Editor scene, and the game moves into it by calling a method where you specify which Facility you want to head into. The options there being SPH or VAB, of course. The implications of such a feature are very far-reaching, but at the moment all we want from it is the added simplicity of working with a single Editor scene (the scenery is loaded on top from separate scenes). Also, this should make it very simple to add a switch to the editor UI to let you simply flick between Mirror (SPH-style) or Radial (VAB-style) symmetry modes. On the same build, on the same vessel. </span></p>

<p><span>To cut it short, all I can say is, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very happy with the stuff IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on. Hopefully they will make everyone happy as well. </span></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>Last week was release week, so I had to set everything ready (servers and website). As you may have noticed, the changes I was doing to the KSP Store website included Ã¢â‚¬Å“Zone PricingÃ¢â‚¬Â, different prices and currency according to the user geographical zone. The main goal of this was to keep our KSP Store prices equal to Steam ones. Also, now you can buy Steam keys directly from our website and use them to activate the game in your Steam account. You should be aware that Steam keys purchased from the KSP Store are not refundable because once you get them, thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s no way for us to prove that the key has not been redeemed and is still valid for another user. Right now and for the last week, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been checking that this system is working as it should and that everyone is getting what they purchased.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been putting the finishing touches to the new Kerbal career logging system and building the new experience system. Kerbals will each be assigned an experience trait when theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re generated and, as they gain experience levels, their trait will boost a vesselÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s performance in a variety of areas. </span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samssonart): </strong><span>The best part of the week was spent containing the vast wave of. customers who weren’t familiar with the workings of the KSP Store and updating and such. Even quite a few really lost ones who donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know the workings of Steam either. Apparently our customer service knows a great deal about Steam </span></p>

<p><span>Back to the game stuff:. I got the KerbalEdu builds ready so Edu users can update to 0.25, I do believe they are ready to download now.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> So, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re working on Upgradeable Buildings. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been on that for more than 2 months, give or take. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a very interesting experience, since IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m supervising the asset creation and had to establish a pipeline to work with the assets that Nick, Roger and myself are doing. I had to dig back into Unity, the different texture maps, and all that technical stuff needed to create environmental models for KSP. You can rest assured that the buildings are in good hands, and that it will meet your expectations. I could write pages and pages here with the details, technicalities, images, concept designsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ But I think itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s better to present all that info in a more interesting way, like a dev blog post or the sort, with everything that concerns those different buildings. .</span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on a new system to organize parts in the VAB/SPH part lists. Basically we are planning on introducing a bunch of new categories and subcategories for parts. Think of a category as the whole ordering system we have atm. and subcategories as the tabs currently in use: pods, propulsion, structural etc. This ordering will remain as itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own category in the new system, but we are also adding more ways to order the parts.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Max (Maxmaps):</strong> <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/312-The-Grand-0-26-Plan"><strong>READ THIS</strong></a><br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker):</strong><span> WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working on our communications plan for 0.26 and making sure we give ourselves enough time for each step of the process. We were stoked to have Nassault deliver a trailer at launch for KSP: Economic Boom, but we didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t factor enough time into it and were forced to finish quite a few things last minute. One of the biggest factors was waiting so long before we worked with the community on naming the update. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll likely be naming 0.26 as well so expect to see some question about that sooner than later. I am also trying to prepare the team for a visit from a reporter to Mexico City later this week. The team doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have a ton of visitors so it should be exciting for everyone. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re also really excited about AlexÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s news about selling Steam keys on our website. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been testing an affiliate program the past few months and this should be a big help for our partners who are sending potential new KSP players our way<strong>.</strong><br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong><span> It’s been a week since 0.25’s release and in that week I’ve been following the issues you guys are posting in the bug tracker, evaluating how the testing process for 0.25 went and setting up a web server here to run a test instance of Redmine (our bug tracking software) in a bid to become more familiar with it throughout.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> I’m working on a contest with Shapeways that will be announced soon. Just getting the final details in order. Anyone like discounts? Not the main prize, obviously <br/></span></p>

<p><br/><strong id="docs-internal-guid-25365312-10c6-22c5-5048-219454db7677"><span>Rogelio (Roger):</span></strong> I feel like itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a lot since last dev notes, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m happy to tell you weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been modeling a lot of new buildings for the game. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working hard last two months to get to very nice results as a team (Dan, Nick and myself). WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve finally got to a very unique art style. Even though I like to animate Kerbals and doing environments for the release videos, getting into the game models production has been a lot of fun. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m sure youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re gonna be amazed about how the buildings will upgrade.</p>

I think trying to guess part rotations during construction is the most frustrating part of the game at the moment...

Get a load of Felipe here with his thumb on the KSP community pulse. Dude, check a census. Part rotation clarity isn't even in the top 10.
Awesome news! Great to hear that Fine Print is becoming stock, and that Porkjet is working on the MK3 overhaul. Also, the kerbal traits sound very interesting!

Kerbals affect ship performance?! Upgradable buildings?! Even MOAR SPACEPLANE PARTS?! Wow. Just wow! Not really sure why rotating parts is such a big deal, maybe reword that bit to "it's a nice little change that needed to be done" or something that's not saying it's the most important thing ever.

Seriously, I wonder what this Kerbal XP thing will do... Also not sure what Upgradable buildings will do either. Maybe like, the tracking station can be upgraded to detect asteroids? Oh, and maybe an upgrade to make the launch pad stronger.

Edited October 14, 2014 by RocketPilot573
So I assume the file named oldSPH in the Ships folder has something to do with the up-gradable buildings.

Sounds like you're doing some commercial alterations... I am not really interested in those, since I already bought the game... Although I do understand your point of view.

The implementation of editor gizmos is something I need to see for myself before I can judge its necessity, I've never used that plugin. To be honest, I never wonder which button (WASDQE) I need... I just look at the navball and press the right buttons... It took some time to learn that, but it really wasn't the greatest hurdle I had to take in KSP.

However, I am looking forward to the upgradable buildings and the career logging system.

So I assume the file named oldSPH in the Ships folder has something to do with the up-gradable buildings.

No it's for the planes with the old parts

I just checked out the Fine Print mod page because I wasn't sure what exactly it did, and it looks awesome! Contracts for bases, space station, and asteroids is pretty much exactly what I wanted:cool:.
Here's to hoping that next devnotes will have pictures!
chooo chooo

chooo chooo

Give it time...not just yet...

I am ecstatic that the editor is getting some much needed love. I've been using Editor Extensions to get around some of its limitations and have effectively been using a unified SPH/VAB for some time, the news that this is coming to stock is fantastic.

The "gizmos" sound interesting, but I really hope that the editor is not becoming entirely mouse-centric. IMO it needs a more robust set of keyboard shortcuts as well.

Better rotation and translation controls are most welcome, I was seriously considering a 6DOF controller just for that. Now I'll wait and see if it's still necessary.

Please, please tell me that the symmetry bugs are being looked at, too.
I'm not sure how I feel about upgradable buildings, and especially Kerbal passive bonuses, but lets see what Squad can do.
Whoa. Sounds like 0.26 is going to be the biggest update for a while. Almost feature-complete?

I'm not sure how I feel about upgradable buildings, and especially Kerbal passive bonuses, but lets see what Squad can do.

We'll still have Sandbox...

Otherwise, looking forward to some Mk3 Shuttle action.

Updating the editor is by far the thing I'm most excited about. Can't tell you how many times I've wanted to pull my hair out because a part wouldn't fit just the way I wanted to. Being able to turn off surface attachment alleviated one teeny tiny source of rage, but there's still so much to be done. Like when you're trying to place a part, and it keeps putting the part way off in the background. There's no way to move the part 3-dimensionally. Sounds like that's what you mean by adding translation, and I'm super excited. I also love the idea of being able to switch from radial to mirror symmetry on the fly. It's gonna make building something like the Dream Chaser much easier (build the plane with mirror symmetry, flip it, build the rocket below with radial).

This is all very exciting! though I'm a little concerned about Kerbals affecting ship performance. would love some more info about this.

a ship should perform the same no matter who is at the controls. the player is ultimately the one piloting.

This is all very exciting! though I'm a little concerned about Kerbals affecting ship performance. would love some more info about this.

a ship should perform the same no matter who is at the controls. the player is ultimately the one piloting.

Hercules Jeb should be able to stear the ship nomatter the G forces lol, or hawk vision Bob would land precisely on any planet without crashing Ã­Â Â½Ã­Â¸â‚¬

This is all very exciting! though I'm a little concerned about Kerbals affecting ship performance. would love some more info about this.

a ship should perform the same no matter who is at the controls. the player is ultimately the one piloting.

Not true... Remember the first time you drove a car!? How much have you improved in handling cars since you've started driving them? I guess the same is true for handling space ships.

- - - Updated - - -

Not true... Remember the first time you drove a car!? How much have you improved in handling cars since you've started driving them? I guess the same is true for handling space ships.

I'm with Capt Snuggler, it's the player's skill that should determine the ship's performance. It's the player who gets better with practice.

Fix the stretched out ground textures please...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96228-What-Happened-To-The-Mun-Texture

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve merged both the VAB and SPH into one single scene
Bravo!!! It never made sense to me that there were two different buildings. Also love what Romfarer and Mu reported. Excellent!! Looking forward to those.

Maxmaps: no need for a mea culpa here. Squad made the right decision to "get it right" rather than "get it published". Your transparency is to be commended. Especially commendable is the rest of the info you laid out for 0.26, instead of Squad's "it's a secret, but you'll be excited". I'm more excited KNOWING what is planned (even if all do not come to fruition) than I am about "it's a secret." "WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re also integrating the related mod Ã¢â‚¬ËœFine PrintÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ to stock" WE HAVE A WINNER.

It's nice that we're getting info again in the DevNotes. the pre-0.25 were long on text and very, VERY short on info. Rowsdower: keep up the good work!

Edited October 15, 2014 by Apollo13

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on a new system to organize parts in the VAB/SPH part lists. Basically we are planning on introducing a bunch of new categories and subcategories for parts. Think of a category as the whole ordering system we have atm. and subcategories as the tabs currently in use: pods, propulsion, structural etc. This ordering will remain as itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own category in the new system, but we are also adding more ways to order the parts.</span></p>

You mention sorting and ordering parts, but you don't mention filtering. Is this in the plan (or can it be? ) I'd love when I have 4 pages of parts to be able to filter by the size I want, or to filter out parts not on a custom list of "favorites" I've built up.

I'm with Capt Snuggler, it's the player's skill that should determine the ship's performance. It's the player who gets better with practice.

It depends. If Jeb's deft controls make the ship spin a little faster, or use less RCS (simulating the ship NOT doing that stupid thing where it spits fuel out of every single jet continuously) then I'm all for it. If Bob can increase your Isp or TWR I'm a bit more leery.

So now we know what the destructible buildings were a side-effect of.

As for the part rotation in the VAB, it's a fair annoyance at presence. The VAB, and worse the SPH, can drive me batty at times, and questions about how to attach X parts in Y fashion aren't uncommon on the forum, indicating the VAB isn't as easy to use as it could be.

And I wonder if the reason "Better Editor Controls" isn't a common feature request is because there isn't a well-known mod that fixes it, and thus few people will even realise it could be better. Editor Extensions does the VAB/SPH symmetry switching and assorted other improvements, but doesn't touch the core controls. Some of the game developers, on the other hand, will be routinely working with 3d modelling software and suchlike - they know how this stuff could be done differently to it is in KSP.

As for kerbal experience, yeah, I really don't want it determining basic rocket performance. That breaks the suspension of disbelief for me.
